data.author: Andrew Holmes

changelog.release_notes:
Thanks for all of the Hearts! 

* Added a static "at a glance" screen for when Jetman goes to sleep so that the time can easily be seen.
* Shake your watch to put it back into "play the game" mode.
* Reduced the timeout to sleep from 10 to 5 minutes.

Colours on Pebble Time are still a work in progress - can only check values in the emulator, so don't know how they look on a real watch.  Will update when my Time gets here.
Adding Universal version of Jetpac Time (working around App Store problem).
Creating Aplite only version to try to make App Store recognise that Jetpac Time is now universal.
Added a fix for tapping/shaking to wake up.  Thanks to Reddit user Woogal !

Initial release.
Let me know if there are problems.  I don't have a Pebble Time yet to test it against, so has only been run in the Emulator.

data.description:
A Jetpac inspired watchface for Pebble Time!

Watch Jetman fly around with his trusty Jetpac.  He's forever looking for the correct rocket parts to blast off to a new planet just like the one he's already on.

Every minute Jetman will destoy rocket parts that he doesn't like.
Every hour, he'll build his rocket and blast off.

Jetpac Time is battery friendly.  
After two minutes Jetman will stop flying around, and only shoot numbers when they should change.
After ten minutes, he'll go to sleep and the digits will change on their own. However, hourly animations will still run.
You can wake jetman by tapping your pebble. 

The number of lives remaining is your Pebble's battery status.

Jetpac Time is inspired by the Ultimate Play the Game's classic ZX Spectrum Jetpac game from 1983.

latest_release.release_notes:
Thanks for all of the Hearts! 

* Added a static "at a glance" screen for when Jetman goes to sleep so that the time can easily be seen.
* Shake your watch to put it back into "play the game" mode.
* Reduced the timeout to sleep from 10 to 5 minutes.

Colours on Pebble Time are still a work in progress - can only check values in the emulator, so don't know how they look on a real watch.  Will update when my Time gets here.

data.title: Jetpac Time
